Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of the following is not OOPS concept in Java?

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which statement is true about java?
Explanation: Java is called ‘Platform Independent Language’ as it primarily works on the principle of ‘compile once, run everywhere’.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which component is responsible to optimize bytecode to machine code?
Explanation: JIT optimizes bytecode to machine specific language code by compiling similar bytecodes at the same time. This reduces overall time taken for compilation of bytecode to machine specific language.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of the below is invalid identifier with the main method?
Explanation: main method cannot be private as it is invoked by external method. Other identifier are valid with main method.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which concept of Java is achieved by combining methods and attribute into a class?
Explanation: Encapsulation is implemented by combining methods and attribute into a class. The class acts like a container of encapsulating properties.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of the following is a type of polymorphism in Java
Explanation: There are two types of polymorphism in Java. Compile time polymorphism (overloading) and runtime polymorphism (overriding).

Subject: JAVA
Question: What is it called if an object has its own lifecycle and there is no owner?

Subject: JAVA
Question: What is it called where child object gets killed if parent object is killed?
Explanation: Composition occurs when child object gets killed if parent object gets killed. Composition is also known as strong Aggregation.

Option D is wrong because "constant" is not a keyword. Constants in Java are marked static and final.

Subject: JAVA
Question: The nested class can be declared ___________________
Explanation: The nested class can be declared with any specifier, unlike the outer classes which can only be declared public or package private. This is a flexibility given for the nested class being a member of enclosing class.

Subject: JAVA
Question: How to create object of the inner class?
Explanation: An instance of inner class can exist only within instance of outer class. To instantiate the inner class, one must instantiate the outer class first. This can be done by the correct syntax above.

Subject: JAVA
Question: How to access static nested classes?
Explanation: Like any other member of the class, the static nested class uses the dot operator to be accessed. The reason behind is, the static classes can’t work with instances, hence we use enclosing class name to access static nested class.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Instance of inner class can exist only _______________ enclosing class.
Explanation: The class defined inside another class is local to the enclosing class. This means that the instance of inner class will not be valid outside the enclosing class. There is no restriction for instance to be private or public always.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which feature of OOP reduces the use of nested classes?
Explanation: Using inheritance we can have the security of the class being inherited. The subclass can access the members of parent class. And have more feature than a nested class being used.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Use of nested class ____________ encapsulation.
Explanation: The use of nested class increases encapsulation as the inner class is getting even more grouped into the enclosing class. Firstly the class encapsulate the data, having nested classes can increase the encapsulation even further.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which among the following is correct advantage of nested classes?
Choice 3: Makes the code efficient and readable
Explanation: The use of nested classes make the code more streamed towards a single concept. This allows to group the most similar and related classes together and makes it even more efficient and readable.

Subject: JAVA
Question: If a declaration of a member in inner class has the same name as that in the outer class, then ________________ enclosing scope.
Choice 1: Outer declaration shadows inner declaration in
Choice 2: Inner declaration shadows outer declaration in
Explanation: The inner class will have more preference for its local members than those of the enclosing members. Hence it will shadow the enclosing class members. This process is known as shadowing.

Explanation: Overriding in Java simply means that the particular method would be called based on the run time type of the object and not on the compile time type. Accessing them using object references is just an extra liberty given by the designers of Java.

Subject: JAVA
Explanation: A reference variable of GFG class is used to point to an object of class GeeksforGeeks. At the time of compilation, the JVM checks whether the method being called is defined in GFG class, but at the runtime, JVM invoke the method of GeeksforGeeks class because the object is from class GeeksforGeeks. Refer to static vs dynamic binding in java for more details.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these class is related to all the exceptions that can be caught by using catch?
Explanation: Error class is related to java run time error that can’t be caught usually, RuntimeExecption is subclass of Exception class which contains all the exceptions that can be caught.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these class is related to all the exceptions that cannot be caught?
Explanation: Error class is related to java run time error that can’t be caught usually, RuntimeExecption is subclass of Exception class which contains all the exceptions that can be caught.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these keywords is used to by the calling function to guard against the exception that is thrown by called function?
Explanation: If a method is capable of causing an exception that it does not handle. It must specify this behaviour the behaviour so that callers of the method can guard themselves against that exception. This is done by using throws clause in methods declaration.

Subject: JAVA
Question: At runtime, error is recoverable.
Explanation: Error is not recoverable at runtime. The control is lost from the application.

Subject: JAVA
Question: A single try block must be followed by which of these?
Explanation: try block can be followed by any of finally or catch block, try block checks for exceptions and work is performed by finally and catch block as per the exception.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these clause will be executed even if no exceptions are found?
Explanation: finally keyword is used to define a set of instructions that will be executed irrespective of the exception found or not.

Subject: JAVA
Choice 4: an exception is thrown at runtime
Explanation:
If you put a finally block after a try and its associated catch blocks, then once execution enters the try block, the code in that finally block will definitely be executed except in the following circumstances: 
1. An exception arising in the finally block itself. 
2. The death of the thread. 
3. The use of System.exit() 
4. Turning off the power to the CPU.

Subject: JAVA
Explanation:
Compilation fails because ArithmeticException has already been caught. ArithmeticException is a subclass of java.lang.Exception, by time the ArithmeticException has been specified it has already been caught by the Exception class.
If ArithmeticException appears before Exception, then the file will compile. When catching exceptions the more specific exceptions must be listed before the more general (the subclasses must be caught before the superclasses).

Subject: JAVA
Question: Exception class is in ----------------package

java.lang.Throwable
public class Exception extends Throwable

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of the following must be true of the object thrown by a throw statement?
Choice 1: It must be assignable to the throwable type
Choice 2: It must be assignable to the error type
Choice 3: It must be assignable to the Exception type
Choice 4: It must be assignable to the string type
Explanation:
The throw statement requires a single argument: a throwable object. Throwable objects are instances of any subclass of the Throwable class. Here’s an example of a throw statement: 
throw someThrowableObject;

Subject: JAVA
Question: FileNotFoundException
Explanation:
public class FileNotFoundException extends IOException
Signals that an attempt to open the file denoted by a specified pathname has failed. 
This exception will be thrown by the FileInputStream, FileOutputStream, and RandomAccessFile constructors when a file with the specified pathname does not exist. It will also be thrown by these constructors if the file does exist but for some reason is inaccessible, for example when an attempt is made to open a read-only file for writing.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Whic of these are java.lang.Error in exception handling in java?
Explanation: An Error is a subclass of Throwable that indicates serious problems that a reasonable application should not try to catch. Most such errors are abnormal conditions. The ThreadDeath error, though a "normal" condition, is also a subclass of Error because most applications should not try to catch it.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which is valid about java.lang.Exceptions?
Choice 1: The class Exception and all its subclasses that are not also subclasses of RuntimeException are checked exceptions
Choice 2: The class error and all its subclasses are unchecked exceptions
Choice 3: The class RuntimeException and all its subclasses are unchecked exceptions
Explanation:
public class Exception extends Throwable
The class Exception and its subclasses are a form of Throwable that indicates conditions that a reasonable application might want to catch. 
The class Exception and any subclasses that are not also subclasses of RuntimeException are checked exceptions. Checked exceptions need to be declared in a method or constructor's throws clause if they can be thrown by the execution of the method or constructor and propagate outside the method or constructor boundary.

Question: What is multithreaded programming?
Choice 1: It’s a process in which two different processes run simultaneously
Choice 2: It’s a process in which two or more parts of same process run simultaneously
Choice 3: It’s a process in which many different process are able to access same information
Choice 4: It’s a process in which a single process can access information from many sources
Explanation: Multithreaded programming a process in which two or more parts of the same process run simultaneously.

Subject: JAVA
Question: What decides thread priority?
Explanation: Thread scheduler decides the priority of the thread execution. This cannot guarantee that higher priority thread will be executed first, it depends on thread scheduler implementation that is OS dependent.

Subject: JAVA
Question: What requires less resources?
Explanation: Thread is a lightweight and requires less resources to create and exist in the process. Thread shares the process resources.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these method can be used to make the main thread to be executed last among all the threads?
Explanation: By calling sleep() within main(), with long enough delay to ensure that all child threads terminate prior to the main thread.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these method is used to explicitly set the priority of a thread?
Explanation: The default value of priority given to a thread is 5 but we can explicitly change that value between the permitted values 1 & 10, this is done by using the method setPriority().

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these method is used to implement Runnable interface?

Choice 3: using resume(0 method when thread was suspended
Explanation: A thread in the runnable state is executing in the Java virtual machine but it may be waiting for other resources from the operating system such as processor.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these class is used to make a thread?
Explanation: Thread class is used to make threads in java, Thread encapsulates a thread of execution. To create a new thread the program will either extend Thread or implement the Runnable interface.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these method of Thread class is used to find out the priority given to a thread?
Explanation: getPriority() Method is used to find priority of the thread.

Subject: JAVA
Question: What does not prevent JVM from terminating?
Explanation: Daemon thread runs in the background and does not prevent JVM from terminating. Child of daemon thread is also daemon thread.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these statements is incorrect?
Choice 1: A thread can be formed by implementing Runnable interface only.
Choice 2: A thread can be formed by a class that extends Thread class.
Choice 3: start() method is used to begin execution of the thread.
Choice 4: run() method is used to begin execution of a thread before start() method in special cases.
Explanation: run() method is used to define the code that constitutes the new thread, it contains the code to be executed. start() method is used to begin execution of the thread that is execution of run(). run() itself is never used for starting execution of the thread.

Subject: JAVA
Question: What is synchronization in reference to a thread?
Choice 1: It’s a process of handling situations when two or more threads need access to a shared resource.
Choice 2: Its a process by which many thread are able to access same shared resource simultaneously.
Choice 3: Its a process by which a method is able to access many different threads simultaneously.
Choice 4: Its a method that allow to many threads to access any information require.
Explanation: When two or more threads need to access the same shared resource, they need some way to ensure that the resource will be used by only one thread at a time, the process by which this is achieved is called synchronization.

Choice 2: Calling notify() method on an object
Choice 3: Calling wait() method on an object
Choice 4: Calling read() method on an InputStream object
Explanation: notify() wakes up a single thread which is waiting for this object.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these method is used to tell the calling thread to give up a monitor and go to sleep until some other thread enters the same monitor?
Explanation: wait() method is used to tell the calling thread to give up a monitor and go to sleep until some other thread enters the same monitor. This helps in avoiding polling and minimizes CPU idle time.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of this method is used to avoid polling in Java?
Explanation: Polling is a usually implemented by looping in CPU is wastes CPU time, one thread being executed depends on other thread output and the other thread depends on the response on the data given to the first thread. In such situation CPU time is wasted, in Java this is avoided by using methods wait(), notify() and notifyAll().

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these method wakes up all the threads?
Explanation: notifyAll() wakes up all the threads that called wait() on the same object. The highest priority thread will run first.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of the following will ensure the thread will be in running state?
Explanation: wait() always causes the current thread to go into the object’s wait pool. Hence, using this in a thread will keep it in running state.

Subject: JAVA
Question: What is true about threading?
Choice 1: run() method calls start() method and runs the code
Choice 3: run() method can be called directly without start() method being called
Choice 4: start() method creates new thread and calls code written in run() method
Explanation: start() eventually calls run() method. Start() method creates thread and calls the code written inside run method.

Subject: JAVA
Question: What is true about time slicing?

Choice 2: Time slicing is the process to divide the available CPU time to available runnable thread

Choice 4: Time slicing allocates more resources to thread
Explanation: Time slicing is the process to divide the available CPU time to available runnable thread.

Subject: JAVA

Explanation: Thread exist in several states, a thread can be running, suspended, blocked, terminated & ready to run.

Subject: JAVA
Question: What will happen if two thread of the same priority are called to be processed simultaneously?
Choice 1: Anyone will be executed first lexographically
Choice 2: Both of them will be executed simultaneously
Choice 3: None of them will be executed
Choice 4: It is dependent on the operating system
Explanation: In cases where two or more thread with same priority are competing for CPU cycles, different operating system handle this situation differently. Some execute them in time sliced manner some depending on the thread they call.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these is superclass of WindowEvent class?
Explanation: ComponentEvent is superclass of ContainerEvent, FocusEvent, KeyEvent, MouseEvent and WindowEvent.

Question: Which of these are integer constants of TextEvent class?
Explanation: TextEvent defines a single integer constant TEXT_VALUE_CHANGED.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these interfaces handles the event when a component is added to a container?
Explanation: The ContainerListener defines methods to recognize when a component is added to or removed from a container.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these methods can be used to know the degree of adjustment made by the user?
Explanation: The amount of the adjustment can be obtained from the getvalue() method, it returns an integer value corresponding to the amount of adjustment made.

Question: Which of these interfaces define a method itemStateChanged()?
Explanation: No Explanation

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these methods is defined in MouseMotionAdapter class?
Explanation: The MouseMotionAdapter class defines 2 methods – mouseDragged() and mouseMoved.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these methods is used to get x coordinate of the mouse?
Explanation: getX() and getY() are used to obtain X AND Y coordinates of the mouse.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these interfaces define four methods?
Explanation: ComponentListener defines four methods componentResized(), componentMoved(), componentShown() and componentHidden().

Question: Which of these constant value will change when the button at the end of scroll bar was clicked to increase its value?
Explanation: UNIT_INCREMENT VALUE will change when the button at the end of scroll bar was clicked to increase its value.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these events is generated when the component is added or removed?
Explanation: A ContainerEvent is generated when a component is added to or removed from a container. It has two integer constants COMPONENT_ADDED & COMPONENT_REMOVED.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these are integer constants of ComponentEvent class?
Explanation: The component event class defines 4 constants COMPONENT_HIDDEN, COMPONENT-MOVED, COMPONENT-RESIZE and COMPONENT-SHOWN.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these methods can be used to obtain the coordinates of a mouse?
Explanation: getPoint() method can be used to obtain coordinates of a mouse, alternatively we can use getX() and getY() methods for x and y coordinates of mouse respectively.

Subject: JAVA
Question: What is an event in delegation event model used by Java programming language?
Choice 1: An event is an object that describes a state change in a source
Choice 2: An event is an object that describes a state change in processing
Choice 3: An event is an object that describes any change by the user and system
Choice 4: An event is a class used for defining object, to create events
Explanation: An event is an object that describes a state change in a source.

Subject: JAVA
Question: What is a listener in context to event handling?
Choice 1: A listener is a variable that is notified when an event occurs
Choice 2: A listener is a object that is notified when an event occurs
Choice 3: A listener is a method that is notified when an event occurs
Explanation: A listener is a object that is notified when an event occurs. It has two major requirements first, it must have been registered with one or more sources to receive notification about specific event types, and secondly it must implement methods to receive and process these notifications.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these methods can be used to know the type of focus change?
Explanation: There are two types of focus events – permanent and temporary. The isTemporary() method indicates if this focus change is temporary, it returns a Boolean value.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these methods can be used to get reference to a component that was removed from a container?
Explanation: The getChild() method returns a reference to the component that was added to or removed from the container.

Question: Which of these methods can be used to change location of an event?
Explanation: No Explanation

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these are integer constants defined in ActionEvent class?
Explanation: Action event defines 4 integer constants ALT_MASK, CTRL_MASK, SHIFT_MASK and ACTION_PERFORMED

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these functions is called to display the output of an applet?
Explanation: Whenever the applet requires to redraw its output, it is done by using method paint().

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these methods can be used to output a string in an applet?
Explanation: drawString() method is defined in Graphics class, it is used to output a string in an applet.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these methods is a part of Abstract Window Toolkit (AWT)
Explanation: paint() is an abstract method defined in AWT.

Subject: JAVA
Question: Which of these modifiers can be used for a variable so that it can be accessed from any thread or parts of a program?
Explanation: The volatile modifier tells the compiler that the variable modified by volatile can be changed unexpectedly by other part of the program. Specially used in situations involving multithreading.

Question: . Applet class is a subclass of the panel class, which is again a subclass of the ………………….. class.
Explanation: -> Component -> Container -> Panel -> Applet -> JApplet

Explanation: A Simple Applet (Output comes in a new java application)

Question: What is the Message is displayed in the applet made by this program? import java.awt.*; import java.applet.*; public class myapplet extends Applet{public void paint(Graphics g){ g.drawString("A Simple Applet", 20, 20);} }
Explanation: the code in pain() method – g.drawString(“A Simple Applet”,20,20); draws a applet box of length 20 and width 20.

Subject: JAVA
Question: What is the Message is displayed in the applet made by this program? import java.awt.*; import java.applet.*; public class myapplet extends Applet{ Graphic g; g.drawString("A Simple Applet", 20, 20); }
Explanation: To implement the method drawString we need first need to define abstract method of AWT that is paint() method. Without paint() method we can not define and use drawString or any Graphic class methods.

Question: The graphics class provides methods to draw a number of graphical figure including i) Text ii) Lines iii) Images iv) Ellipse
Choice 4: All i, ii, iii and iv
Explanation: We can draw Text, Lines in applet window by using Graphics class, including text, lines, we can add shapes, Images to the applet.

Question: The ………………. method is called to clear the screen and calls the paint( ) method.
